result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K Melville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

May transfer Probation to Milwaukee County.
03/07/18 PROBATION WAS MODIFIED FROM 5 YEARS TO 3 YEARS.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to the victim ($3,368.46); Golden Rule Insurance ($1,403.77) and Crime Victim Compensation Fund ($349.23) has been disputed and future hearing will be held for decision.
09/05/2017 PER RESTITUTION HEARING, COURT ORDERS $349.23 OWED AND TO BE PAID WITHIN 2 YEARS. COURT WILL REVIEW PAYMENT HISTORY AT THAT TIME.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with the victim or his residence or any family members. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Exhibits 1-6, sealed by the Court.

Defendant Richard K Melville in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses restitution. Defense provides the court with documentation in support of their arguments. Atty. Silver requests restitution be set at zero given the victim's non appearance. State gives arguments and provides the court with documentation in support. State calls Rhonda Mitchell to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. State offers exhibits 1-4 and moves for the admission of exhibits 2-4. No objection from the Defense. Court receives exhibits 2-4. State offers exhibit 5. State moves for the admission of exhibits 1 and 5. Defense objects. Court will receive exhibits 1 and 5 over the objection of the Defense. Cross examination by the Defense. Redirect by the State. No further questions from the Defense. Court questions witness. No follow up questions from the parties. Witness is excused. For reasons set out on the record, the Court will find that restitution is due and owing in the amount of $349.23. Court now addresses defendant's ability to pay. Defense calls Richard Melville to the stand, sworn in and testifies. No questions from the State. Witness is excused. State gives closing arguments. Defense gives closing arguments. For reasons stated on the record, the Court will order the restitution in the amount of $349.23 be paid over 2 years. After 2 years the Court will review the defendant's payments. Defense moves for the admission of exhibit 6. No objection from the State. Court receives exhibit 6. State moves to have all exhibit sealed. Defense agrees. Court orders exhibits 1-6 be sealed.  Check Case scheduled for September 5, 2019.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Richard K Melville in court with Attorney Kelsey Loshaw.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty/alford plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State files a victim impact statement.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  State requests restitution in the amounts of:  $3,368.46 to the victim,  $1,403.77 to Golden Rule Insurance, and $349.23 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.   Attorney Loshaw makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defense disputes restitution amounts and requests a restitution hearing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT           *CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE*
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS   * CONCURRENT WITH PRESENT SENTENCE*   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim or his residence or any family members
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  Being disputed - court sets restitution hearing date

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
 
  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
